did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Henry County (Va.) List of subscribers for building a new Baptist church near Leatherwood Store, undated

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Henry County (Va.) List of subscribers for building a new Baptist church near Leatherwood Store, undated. Local government records collection, Henry County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia 23219-8000.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of records from Henry County.
This collection is located at the State Records Center. Contact Archives Research Services for access information, directions, and hours.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Henry County was named for Patrick Henry, revolutionary leader and first governor of the commonwealth of Virginia. It was formed from Pittsylvania County in 1776.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Henry County (Va.) List of subscribers for building a new Baptist church near Leatherwood Store, undated. The record contains the names of 66 people who pledged to help pay for construction of a new Baptist church, and a list of articles concerning the planned building. The articles stipulate that the church should be a frame construction, 52 feet by 32 feet, and that it should be open to use by both parties to a schism among local Baptists, i.e., the Old Leatherwood Baptist Church and the Missionary Baptist Church.
